III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Program statement
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
2

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Around 1/30/24, a staff member threw things at a youth's head
while they slept. Details regarding this are unknown. Youth did not
sustain injuries. Youth reported this to their mother. A staff
member and a supervisor were made aware. It is unknown what if
any action was taken. At an unknown date, staff left the unit and
left 3 youth unsupervised. Two youth assaulted the third youth.
Youth received medical treatment as a result due to facial
fractures and a concussion.
Investigation The complainant is this consultant as during an interview the
above information was shared regarding the facility.
Director was interviewed face to face at the facility on
February 29, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Director reported the only staff named “Staff 1” at the facility is the
cook and he does not work the unit. Director stated he was not
aware of any staff having or using the nickname “Staff 1.” Director
denied being aware of any staff throwing objects at Youth A’s head
to wake him up. Director stated he was aware of the incident of
two youth going after Youth A. Director denied the youths were
left alone and stated Staff 2 was in the unit during the event and
Staff 3 came to assist. Director reported he reviewed camera
footage of the incident and stated Youth A and Youth B got into a
verbal argument, Youth A kicked Youth B in the genitals, Youth C
came to assist Youth B and Staff 2 got between Youth A and Youth
B to separate them. Director reported Staff 2 handled the situation
appropriately, no youths were restrained, and the youth were not
left alone from what Director reviewed on camera.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on February
29, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 1 denied
ever working on the unit with the youths or helping staff wake up
the youth. Staff 1 reported he is the cook for the facility and sets
up meals for the youth or will bring snacks over to the facility.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
February 29, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth
A described a staff, maybe Staff 2, threw a stress ball a couple of
times at his head when Youth A was trying to sleep. Youth A
stated it happened in the morning and believed it happened twice.
Youth A denied any other staff being around. Youth A reported
3

Staff 1 is the “lunch guy” and stated Staff 1 does not work on the
unit and was not the staff who throw the stress ball.
Youth A described being in the dayroom with Youth B and Youth C
and getting into a fight. Youth A reported there were two or three
staff around when the fight happened. Youth A stated he could not
remember how the fight started or the staff’s name who was in the
dayroom. Youth A described Staff 3 coming to the unit to help.
Youth A reported one of the staff still works at the facility but one of
the staff does not. Youth A described one of the staff broke up the
fight and cleaned up Youth A’s bloody nose then Medical
Technician examined Youth A. Youth A reported it was the first
time Youth B fought him like that and Youth B tried again to fight
Youth A. Youth A stated each time staff were present and
intervened. Youth A reported Youth B is no longer at the facility
and Youth C is at a hospital. Youth A stated he did not have any
concerns with how staff intervened and reported feeling safe at the
facility.
Case Manager was interviewed face to face at the facility on
February 29, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Case
Manager stated she did not recall Youth A saying anything on a
phone call with Parent about a staff throwing a ball at his head to
wake him up. Case Manager reported she believed Parent told
her about it and Case Manager spoke with Director or Assistant
Facility Administrator, but Case Manager could not specifically
recall. Case Manager reported when monitoring phone calls, she
does not listen that closely to what is being said, she only listens
for key words like AWOL. Case Manager denied hearing any
concerns from youth about any staff throwing objects at their
heads to wake them up in the morning.
Youth B was interviewed via telephone on March 6, 2024, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker 2 who was with Youth B at a
different facility. Youth B described Youth A as being a “pain in
the ass and spoiled.” Youth B stated he did get in a couple fights
with Youth A while at the facility. Youth B described one fight
started when Youth A took a ball from Youth B, so Youth B hit
Youth A in the face and Youth A punched Youth B in the gut. Youth
B stated we (DHHS Worker and I) should talk with Youth C
because he also got into it with Youth A. Youth B described
running after Youth A and Youth C tried to stop Youth B. Youth B
stated Youth A kicked Youth B in his private parts and Youth C
went off and went after Youth A and broke Youth A’s nose. Youth
4

B reported staff were “right there” when the fight took place. Youth
B stated he could not recall the names of the staff but there were
two staff on the unit, and they stopped the fight. Youth B stated
staff were “always there.” Youth B reported the other fight had to
do when Youth A tried to hit a female staff and Youth B got upset
and yelled at Youth A, but it never got physical. Youth B denied
staff ever throwing anything at his head to wake him up in the
mornings. Youth B stated he never saw any staff throw any
objects at youth to wake them up. Youth B reported not hearing
any youth say staff threw objects at their heads.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on March 11, 2024, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker who was also via telephone.
Staff 3 described hearing Staff 2 request staff assistance over the
radio. Staff 3 reported when he entered the dayroom Youth C was
standing over Youth A who was bleeding. Staff 3 stated Staff 2
was about eight to ten feet away using proximity to keep Youth B
away from Youth A and Youth C. Staff 3 denied seeing any of the
youths punch one another, he only saw Youth A bleeding after the
fight. Staff 3 stated he called Medical Technician, and she came
to examine Youth A. Staff 3 reported Staff 2 told him he threw a
stress ball at Youth A to wake him up in the morning. Staff 3
denied ever seeing Staff 2 do this or any of the youths telling Staff
3 about it. Staff 3 stated he told Director what Staff 2 told him.
Staff 3 reported he was only aware of the one-time Staff 2 threw a
stress ball at Youth A.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on March 12, 2024, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker who was at Staff 2’s home.
Staff 2 described during nightly chores Youth A and Youth B
started arguing with one another. Staff 2 stated Youth D got
scared from Youth A and Youth B so ran out of the dayroom to his
room down the hallway. Staff 2 reported he went to Youth D’s
room to check in on him when he heard Youth A and Youth B start
to argue again. Staff 2 stated he told Youth A and Youth B to stop
arguing, directed them to finish their chores and get ready for bed.
Staff 2 reported a short period of time later Youth A and Youth B
started pushing one another so he got in between them. Staff 2
stated Youth C joined the fight and started hitting Youth A. Staff 2
described calling for extra staff to help while he continued to stand
in between Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C. Staff 2 stated he was
able to separate Youth B and Youth C prior to the extra staff
person arriving. Staff 2 denied any youth being placed in a
restraint. Staff 2 reported he felt he handled the situation
5

appropriately. Staff 2 stated Youth A was taken to the hospital to
have his injuries examined.
Staff 2 denied ever throwing a stress ball at Youth A while Youth A
was sleeping. Staff 2 reported Youth C once threw a stress ball at
Youth A because Youth A was refusing to get out of bed for school.
Staff 2 stated he did not believe the stress ball hit Youth A but
could not recall. Staff 2 reported the stress balls were small nerf
balls youth at the facility were given to help with stress. Staff 2
stated he did not believe a youth could get injured from having
one thrown at them.
Youth C was interviewed via telephone on March 12, 2024, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker who was at the hospital with
Youth C. Youth C refused to answer any questions and walked
out of the room. Hospital staff attempted to have Youth C come
back into the room to be interviewed but he again refused.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident Report for Youth A dated 01/02/24 completed by
Staff 2: Consistent with youths and staff interviews.
• Nursing Progress Note for Youth A dated 01/02/24:
indicates Youth A was examined after altercation and taken
to hospital to be examined.
• Corewell Health Reed City Hospital Emergency report for
Youth A dated 01/02/2024 documents facial injury and facial
fractures.
• Staff 2’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record
and Staff completed the required Safe Crisis Management
training on 10/23/23.
• Youth Opportunity Osceola Youth Center Policies an
Procedure Youth Supervision, Movement Checks states,
Program staff shall maintain active supervision of youth,
including interacting positively with youth, engaging in a full
schedule of constructive activities, closely observing
behavior of youth and changes in behavior and consistently
applying the behavior management system.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as interviews with Youth A,
Youth B, Youth C, Director, Staff 2, and Staff 3 reported Staff 2
was in the dayroom when Youth A was physically assaulted and
appropriately intervened.
6

Youth A said a ball was thrown at him and Staff 3 indicated Staff 2
told him he through a ball at Youth A and he told the Director.
Staff 2 denied throwing a ball and the Director denied anyone
telling him a staff threw a ball at youth.
Technical Assistance:
Technical assistance was offered for the agency to monitor phone
conversations youth are having more closely. Also, when
reviewing Staff 2’s personnel file it was found Staff 2 was cleared
to work for a different facility within the organization. The agency
needs to request clearance approval for the facility where the
individual will be working.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Per Special investigation 2024SIC0001140, a 1st
provisional license is recommended.
